byline.original: By ALEXANDRA STEVENSON and MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN

abstract: Wall Street veterans like former Goldman Sachs executive Daniel Sparks have started firms that focus on buying long-term installment contracts for homes sold to buyers who cannot secure mortgages; firms like Sparks's Shelter Growth Capital Partners have essentially bet on home buyers excluded from currently strict mortgage market; contracts enable buyers to be evicted far more quickly than through traditional foreclosure process.

headline.print_headline: Wall St. Veterans Are Betting on Low-Income Homebuyers
headline.main: Wall Street Veterans Bet on Low-Income Home Buyers

snippet: Goldman Sachs alumni are reselling foreclosed homes to people who didn’t qualify for traditional mortgages. Many of the transactions end in eviction.
lead_paragraph: Goldman Sachs alumni are reselling foreclosed homes to people who didn’t qualify for traditional mortgages. Many of the transactions end in eviction.
